headline: Buy Now, Pay Later loans will soon affect some credit scores
summary: Hundreds of millions of ‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ loans will soon affect credit scores for millions of Americans who use the loans to buy clothing, furniture, concert tickets, and takeout.  A majority of lenders use FICO scores to determine a borrower’s credit worthiness.  Previously, the loans had been excluded, though Buy Now, Pay Later company Affirm began voluntarily reporting pay-in-four loans to Experian, a separate credit bureau, in April.
